body.p: The undersigned would respectfully represent to his Excellency Gov Thos E. Bramlette of Ky. that there are many considerations why Amanda Thomas a woman of color ^now confined in State Prison^ should receive Executive clemency- Promenint among these are 1st that she was not principle in the matter (the charge was larceny) but was over reached by a cunning & designing negro girl Ellen Bascom (who died shortly after conviction) This latter girl behaved in so insolent a manner upon the trial interrupting the witnesses, insulting the court &c as to greatly increase & aggravate the verdict. Both being tried together the Jury were of the opinion that they could not be convicted for different terms 2ndly She is a young woman & the mother of two small children, wholy dependent upon her aged mother for support There is much ^reason^ hope to believe that she is now repentant & wil not again by evil associations be indu-ced to sin again in that respect but will act in a manner worthy of her former self

H Barhaw
G W Doney
E T Bannon
N. A. Humber (Atty)
J. McCarthy (atty)

Rev Mr. Merritt states that he knows the former master of the girl in question Mr. Levin Dorsey who is one of the signers of this petition that he has seen the girl about the House True to for a number of years and that so far as he knows she was a good girl, that her husband was in the army of the U. S and there died, that He is informed that she has never received anything for his service, and that her children are now dependent on the girls mother for support, who is living at her former masters --
